channel.title: [UPDATE] tables & guest book + user accounts
channel.description:
hay all ive not been well right now and i just cant get my head around this (probs because im not well) ohh well anyway i want a table that is the full size of a standard webpage 100% by 100% i guess then well ill put i pick of the layout of the table it would take like 30 seconds to whip up just im a bit thick when im not fealing to good anyway here is the pick if poss could it be in 1 table the full with of the page and full hight
hears the pick thanks
[EDIT] id also like to know how a guest book works lets say you make a simple page with 3 boxes and 1 submit button one for email one for name and one for comments when they press the button haw can you get it to save to a place on your website were you can only get in to + how can i make a username and password database were you need to log in to to get to some page and if you are not loged in you can not go to that page i think you use php but that's all i know ive looked on www.google.com but they don't answer the question im asking if you know what i meen maby some one here can

item.title: [UPDATE] tables & guest book + user accounts
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

thanks ron can you get it 100% down the page or will that come as you add text i want this to be the main lay out of my pages[br][size=1]Posted on: December 25, 2006, 09:03:28 AM[/size][hr]ohh god what the hell am i doing wrong now lol if you want to add another tablw into a table you would do it like?

here is what ive done

[code]

Hello!

Hey!
[code]

[from ron’s code][/code][/code][br][size=1]Posted on: December 25, 2006, 09:22:22 AM[/size][hr]ny one[br][size=1]Posted on: December 26, 2006, 03:55:31 PM[/size][hr]ny one

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATE] tables & guest book + user accounts
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Here you go! 

<html>
<head>
<title></title>
</head>
<body>
 <table width="100%" border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
  <tr>
   <td align="center" colspan="2"><h2>Hello!</h2></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
   <td width="20%" align="center" valign="top"><h2>Hi!</h2></td>
   <td width="80%" valign="top"><h2>Hey!</h2></td>
  </tr>
 </table>
</body>
</html>

~Ron

Read full topic
